definition: the 60th part of an hour of time : 60 seconds

the 60th part of a degree of angular measure                                      
             
             Its latitude is 41 degrees 55 minute north.

the distance one can traverse in a minute                                      
             
             Five minutes down the road is a gas station.

a short space of time : moment                                      
             
             Dinner will be ready in just a few minutes.

a brief note (as of summary or recommendation)                                      
             
             He received a minute of instructions.

memorandum, draft                                      
             
             sent the president a minute explaining the problem

the official record of the proceedings of a meeting                                      
             
             The secretary read the minutes of the previous meeting.
very small : infinitesimal
of small importance : trifling
marked by close attention to details
to make notes or a brief summary of
a unit of time equal to 60 seconds : one 60th of an hour
a brief period of time
the distance that can be traveled in a minute
very small
very complete and precise
a unit of time equal to 60 seconds : the 60th part of an hour

moment sense 1                                      
             
             Can you wait a minute?
one of 60 equal parts into which a degree can be divided for measuring angles
a brief record of what was said and done during a meeting

very small : tiny                                      
             
             minute particles of dust

marked by or paying attention to small details                                      
             
             a minute description
a 60th part of an hour of time or of a degree
a brief note (as of summary or recommendation)
memorandum sense 1
the official record of the proceedings of a meeting or court
in: Its latitude is 41 degrees 55 minute north.
Five minutes down the road is a gas station.
Dinner will be ready in just a few minutes.
He received a minute of instructions.
sent the president a minute explaining the problem
The secretary read the minutes of the previous meeting.
a relatively small backyard
your pathetic little smile
diminutive bonsai plants
a minute amount of caffeine in the soda
tiny cracks formed in the painting
a dollhouse with miniature furnishings
a circumstantial account of our visit
a minute examination of a fossil
a particular description of the scene of the crime
a detailed analysis of the event

We waited for several minutes, but no one came to the door.
I saw him a minute ago.
One minute it was sunny, the next it was pouring rain.
My house is just a few minutes from here.

The test detected minute amounts of contamination.
The equipment is able to detect the minutest errors.
She told him what happened in minute detail.
a minute examination of the evidence
Can you wait a minute?
minute particles of dust
a minute description
He lifted the wand and examined it minutely …

definition: a period of 60 seconds. There are 60 minutes in one hour
a short period of time
the distance that you can travel in a minute
a moment or point in time
one of the 60 parts of a degree  (=a unit used in the measurement of angles)
an official written record of what is discussed or decided at a formal meeting
a short note or report about a particular subject
to be extremely busy
in: I’ll meet you downstairs in ten minutes.
We waited until twenty minutes to ten, then left.
Thompson scored again in the final minutes of the game.
It will only take a minute.
Carole spends every spare minute practising.
for a minute: For a minute I thought she had left.
The city centre is ten minutes away.
One minute he was there; the next he was gone.
any minute  (=very soon): Jack should be here any minute.
within minutes: Within minutes I realized I was on the wrong train.
Shall we hear the minutes of the last meeting?
take the minutes  (=write them): Carl usually takes the minutes but he’s not here tonight.
by the minute
every minute counts
every minute (of something)
hang on/hold on a minute
the last minute
the minute you do something
not for a/one minute
this minute
wait/just a minute
synonym: at right angles to/at a right angle to

definition: one of the 60 parts that an hour is divided into, consisting of 60 seconds:
used in spoken English to mean a very short time:
the written record of what was said at a meeting:
an official message from one person to another in an organization:
any of the 60 parts that the degrees of any angle are divided into
to make a written record of what is said at a meeting:
extremely small:
any of the 60 parts that an hour is divided into; 60 seconds:
A minute is also a very short time:
the written record of what was said and decided at a meeting:
to write down what is said at a meeting and by whom:
an official message or written statement that records a decision and often gives permission for an action to be taken:
to make a written record of what was said at a meeting:
in: a 20-minute bus ride
It takes me 20 minutes to get to work.
The train leaves at three minutes to eight, so we'd better get there a few minutes before then.
Hang on/Wait a minute - I just have to get my bag.
Just a minute - I'll be with you when I've finished this.
I won't be a minute (= I will be ready soon).
When you've got a minute, I'd like a brief word with you.
Could you take/do (= write) the minutes, Daniel?
The minutes of the last meeting were approved unanimously (= everyone agreed that they were correct).
I've just received a minute from Clark authorizing the purchase of six more computers.
The chairman is minuted as having said that profits had fallen to an all-time low.
a minute amount/quantity
I've never seen a man with such tiny hands - they're minute!
The documentary showed an eye operation in minute detail (= showing every small detail).
Just a minute – I’m almost ready.
When you’ve got a minute, I’d like to talk to you.
minute amounts/quantities
She examined the contract in minute detail (= looking at all the details of it).
The company publishes the minutes of all its meetings online.
agree/approve the minutes
It is part of her job to set the agenda for board meetings and take the minutes.

There did not appear to be any proper board minute approving the sale.

definition: A very long time.

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
Might be 20 minutes, 5 minutes or a week or a year... but rarely really just one minute...
used when talking about a period of time much longer than an actual minute. sometimes also called "an ill minute" or "a hot minute".
just count to 60
A long time.
it does not mean 60 seconds when used in slang terms. Usually means a long time, from a week to a few months, maybe even a year.
